meanings.definition: To become red in the face from embarrassment or shame.
meanings.sent1: She would blush whenever she made a mistake in front of others.
meanings.sent2: The little girl started to blush when everyone sang her a birthday song.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but blush when he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The sunset made the sky blush with vibrant hues of red and orange.
meanings.sent5: Her cheeks would always blush like a rose whenever she was praised.

meanings.definition: A reddening of the face from embarrassment or shame.
meanings.sent1: Her sudden blush gave away her embarrassment to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The shy boy's blush was noticeable as he spoke in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The cat's unexpected meow caused a blush of surprise on the owner's face.
meanings.sent4: The blush of the morning sun painted the sky in soft pastel colors.
meanings.sent5: The blush on her cheeks was like a delicate flower blooming in the spring.
